snippet: A doctor, convicted in Pakistan of treason for helping the C.I.A. track down Osama bin Laden, had 10 years cut from his 33-year sentence.
abstract: Pakistani official reduces by 10 years the 33-year sentence of Shakil Afridi, Pakistani medical doctor who had been convicted of treason for helping Central Intelligence Agency track down Osama bin Laden.
lead_paragraph: A doctor, convicted in Pakistan of treason for helping the C.I.A. track down Osama bin Laden, had 10 years cut from his 33-year sentence.

headline.main: Sentence Cut for Bin Laden Figure
